laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Illumigene DNA amplification assay for C. difficile
laboratory_examinations.findings: Negative for toxigenic C. difficile (Reference Range-Negative).

findings.Lower Thorax: Trace bilateral pleural effusions and mild dependent atelectasis of the visualized lung bases.
findings.Liver: Right hepatic lobe elongated, measuring 23.8 cm; no hepatic steatosis; heterogeneous enhancement; mild periportal edema; inflammatory stranding of porta hepatis; no focal lesion; small amount of perihepatic fluid.
findings.Biliary: Surgically absent gallbladder; drain in place from right anterolateral approach; biliary trifurcation noted; mildly dilated common bile duct (7 mm); fluid collection in gallbladder fossa (2.0 x 3.1 cm) with biliary leak indicated.
findings.Pancreas: Pancreas divisum; no ductal dilatation; normal parenchyma.
findings.Adrenal Glands: Left adrenal gland thickened without discrete nodule; right adrenal within normal limits.
findings.Kidneys: 4 mm T1 hyperintense lesion (hemorrhagic or proteinaceous cyst); 1.7 x 1.3 cm simple cyst in right kidney; left kidney normal; no hydronephrosis.
findings.Gastrointestinal Tract: Postsurgical changes of Roux-en-Y gastric bypass; nondilated upper abdominal bowel loops.
findings.Vasculature: Abdominal aorta and major mesenteric branches normal in caliber and patent.
findings.Osseous and Soft Tissue Structures: Open surgical wound along midline to right anterior abdominal wall with associated subcutaneous edema.
